programme.desc: Punk Chef Scott Garthwaite travels to Ludlow in Shropshire to cook the best of British food in front a live audience at the Ludlow Food Festival.
programme.title: BSL Zone: Punk Chef on the Road
Rugrats Go Wild
programme.desc: Family animation. The children and their parents get stranded on a desert island. But help is at hand from the Thornberry family, who travel the world making nature documentaries.
Oscar-nominated animation. A boy goes on a spooky and perilous magical quest to find his samurai father's lost armour and learn the truth about the events that tore his family apart.
programme.title: Kubo and the Two Strings

programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Nicola Peltz, Jackson Rathbone and Noah Ringer. In a world that's descending into turmoil, only finding a lost Avatar can bring about harmony. Violence.
programme.title: The Last Airbender
Paddington
programme.desc: Part-animated family fun. Hugh Bonneville, Sally Hawkins and Nicole Kidman star in this adaptation of Michael Bond's tales of the adventures of a small bear (voiced by Ben Whishaw).
Remake of the sci-fi classic. Alien Keanu Reeves visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead. Violence.
programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still

programme.desc: Part five of the action-thriller franchise starring Tom Cruise. The secret agents try to stop a terrorist organisation, but find themselves disbanded and hunted by the CIA. Violence.
programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Rogue Nation
Area 51
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror. Four friends attempt to break into the US Air Force base in Nevada where, they believe, the government is hiding evidence of extraterrestrial life. Strong language.
Menacing psychodrama starring Toby Jones. An Englishman is hired to create sound effects for a horror film studio in 1970s Rome. But the job takes a heavy toll on his mental health.
programme.title: Berberian Sound Studio
